In these circumstances , dangerousness of the crime to which the law refers is in itself sufficient to anticipate undesirable conduct on the part of the accused , including continuation of criminal activities and absconding upon commission of a crime , in other words the reference in the law to the dangerous nature of a crime enables the investigative authorities to anticipate these very events to which the [ NORP ] Convention refers .

CARDINAL . A repetition of criminal offences exists if the suspect has committed CARDINAL or more offences characterised under the same provision of LAW ( LAW ) . Criminal offences are not considered repetitive if the proceedings in respect of the previously committed offence have been discontinued or if the criminal record of that offence has been extinguished or purged ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL established that simple theft was punishable by up to CARDINAL GPE imprisonment . CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE adopted an act of amnesty in commemoration of the CARDINALth anniversary of the victory in the Great Patriotic War of DATE ( Second World War ) .
